intro: Cheiranthus glaberrimus, commonly known as the smooth wallflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with four petals arranged symmetrically. It is often found in alpine or coastal areas, where it adapts well to harsh conditions.
